title: LETTERS: Parkview hospital unfairly attacked
text:
PRESS-ENTERPRISE
Published: Oct. 2, 2015 Updated: 5:44 p.m. “Parkview hospital management ignoring workers” [Opinion, Sept. 23]: As one of more than 1,300 employees of Parkview Community Hospital, I feel the need to speak up on behalf of this very important institution, which has been serving the community for more than 50 years.
In my nearly three years here, I have seen a new CEO come and take immediate charge, repairing and remodeling many areas of the hospital, adding state-of-the-art equipment, instituting forward-thinking practices (such as our “Parkview by Design” method of evaluating and improving processes, including being open to considerable direction from staff), and being extraordinarily approachable with employees, holding open forums several times a year where he encourages employees to “ask anything that is on their minds.”
My job takes me into the community, where I have heard many positive testimonials – unsolicited – about the great care received at Parkview. I have spoken to many patients who have had their babies here, a knee replaced, weight loss surgery performed and much more. My own family member had excellent care in the emergency room.
Nurses with more than 25 years of experience have chosen to stay with this hospital “family” because of the good work being done here.
As the only nonprofit community hospital in Riverside, our leaders have a fiscal responsibility to use every dollar efficiently and effectively. I believe that our administrators are working toward making us the best hospital possible.
I have never worked with an organization that could not improve something, and it is unfair to paint the hospital with a broad brush of negativity when so many good people and so much good care are at the heart of who we are.
Donna Doty Michalka
Riverside
Community relations, Parkview Community Hospital
